availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alvin Alexander Chickering (Louisville, KY, grocer and bottler)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, bottler and grocer. New Hampshire native. Married to Helen Mary Hale Chickering. Father of Frank Chickering, Isabel Chickering, Alice Chickering, Alvin Chickering, Katie Chickering, Ida Chickering, and Lilly Chickering. Bottler in Louisville in 1860. Grocer in Louisville in 1860. Employed Frank Chickering as a clerk in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 2, p. 259.
“A. A. Chickering, Sr.,” Courier-Journal (Louisville, KY), April 1, 1896, p. 10.
"Alvin Alexander Chickering (1821-1896)," Find A Grave, Memorial #95039583, accessed October 6, 2017, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/95039583.
Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates – Microfilm (1911-1964), KDLA, Roll #7019174, Jefferson County Deaths, File #1761.
